div.p: This element belongs conceptually to WRITING RECEPTION . It encloses at least a sentence, or a statement long enough for clarity, about negative or harmful consequences of writingâ€”family disapproval, legal action, imprisonment, banning of text (see attribute CENSORSHIP), etc. It has one optional attribute, CENSORSHIP, with a value of CensorshipYes.

div.codeblock: <RPENALTIES CENSORSHIP="CensorshipYes">Elizabeth Cellier and her publisher were both arrested and made to give security for their future good behaviour. Copies of her book were burned, and she was sentenced to stand in the pillory three times.</RPENALTIES> <RPENALTIES>Maggie Lisp was thrown out of her home when her parents discovered she had been writing poetry.</RPENALTIES>

div.p: These penalties should be event-centred and not deal with individual reviews or overall movements.
